Description: Rim and floor sherd of black-figured North Ionian pottery plate (most of rim lost); cream slip; glaze mostly fired orange; on inner edge of rim, between two lines, meander band; at edge of floor metopal frieze of ‘triglyphs’ (three vertical lines) and ‘metopes’ (black square with added red centre; open square with four dots); two bands surround tondo: part of the body of an animal perhaps to right (head and legs lost; added red blobs on flank and under belly); underside: two flat mouldings and glaze banding.
Curator's comments: Also very close are Philadelphia E179.2 and Boston MFA 88.825 (which preserves a sofa rim).
This sherd may belong with GR 1965.9-30.497 and 1924,1201.339. Compare R M Cook, East Greek Pottery (1998), 96 fig. 12.1 (a): ‘precursor of Clazomenian Black-figure’.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.806)
